name: Overview of my work
body:
**This page is still under construction. Not all the projects have been listed here. A lot more will come.**

### Welcome
You will find here several projects that I have developed throughout the last years. Most of them have been developed during my studies at [EPITECH](http://www.epitech.eu/). In order to get a better overview, I will chronologically sort them per school year.

### First year (2010-2011)

* [alumn-1](http://gregoireborel.github.io/alumn-1/) - Nim game in C
* [minitalk](http://gregoireborel.github.io/minitalk/) - Client-server program in C
* [get_next_line](http://gregoireborel.github.io/get_next_line/) - Function that returns a line read in a file descriptor
* [42sh](http://gregoireborel.github.io/42sh/) - POSIX Shell developed in C

### Second year (2011-2012)

* [Nibbler](http://gregoireborel.github.io/nibbler/) - 
* [Bomberman](http://gregoireborel.github.io/bomberman/) - 
* [Trade](http://gregoireborel.github.io/trade/) - 

### Third year (2012-2013)

* [BabyMeatZombies]( http://gregoireborel.github.io/BabyMeatZombies) - A 2D zombie game in C# using XNA 4.0
* [Gomoku]( http://gregoireborel.github.io/gomoku) - Gomoku game in C#

### Fourth year (2013-2014)
This year was a special one. We had the obligation to spend the year abroad. I chose Ireland and thus went to Dublin from September 2013 to May 2014. While over there, I studied at the [Griffith Dublin College](http://www.griffith.ie/) (and also drank a lot of beer) and practiced my English. However, I still learnt new things. Here is a non-exhaustive list of modules in which I participated:

* Data Structure and Algorithms (Java)
* Programming Paradigms (Scala)
* Distributed Systems (C++)
* Game Design (study of gameplay mechanisms)
* HCI and GUI Programming (Java SWING)
    * [Chess game](http://gregoireborel.github.io/chess) -  Chess game in Java
* Web Frameworks (Rails)
    * [FakeBook](http://gregoireborel.github.io/FakeBook) - A very tiny social network written with Rails
* Emerging Technologies (Android)
    * [GPS Tracker](http://gregoireborel.github.io/GPSTracker) - Android application that tracks and stores user's location, distance, speed and time

I also continued to work on my studies final project.

### Fifth year (2014-2015)



### Other

* [My resume](https://github.com/gregoireborel/resume/blob/master/resume-gregoire-borel.pdf?raw=true)

### Authors and Contributors
I'm a french student in fifth year at EPITECH. I'm passionate about science in general and would like to find a work in a field that could mix my computing skills within a scientific background. I'm especially thinking about the aerospace and robotics technologies.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
